results.description:
A Shamanic journey of ancient remembering. A healing ceremony of the Soul lead by Kevon Simpson.

What is Light Of Iris?

Love Includes Growing Heights Together of Integration Responsibility Intuition and Simplicity. Light of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that uses meditation, journaling, dance, drawing, music, and .... more to help facilitate lasting emotional healing and a permanent expansion of consciousness. For some that means increased creativity, for others that can mean healing deeply repressed childhood wounds in a matter of hours, for some it can mean reawakening a connection to ones ancestors and their power. It is named after my late Great Grandmother Iris Palmer who came to me in a vision as pure light during a previous ceremony. I don't have the right words to describe the impact that had on me, but we do want to share that possibility with others. This is about remembering who you are and standing in that power. To honor the privacy of our participants. No further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation. Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list. We love you :-) ♥,
Team Iris
results.name: Light Of Iris November Ceremony

results.description:
For more details and tickets click here: https://goo.gl/Atnpxu

Making delicious macarons is a true art. The popularity of this French dessert has only exploded in the past few years. During this 2h 30min session, you will learn how to prepare, bake, and make this delightful and light pastry. Chef Simon will guide and teach you every step of the way in order for you to perfect the recipe behind this sophisticated delicacy. From whipping the meringue into the base to piping the shells onto a sheet and cooking an exquisite ganache, guests will acquire the essential techniques to be able to replicate the recipe at home. Sharpen your macaron cooking skills with Chef Simon!
results.name: Learn the Art of French Macarons!

results.description:
Approximately once a month the Copacabana sets aside a venue for us....., the "Young at Heart Seniors".  ..... So let us make some memories this Holiday weekend, and show the COPA that we appreciate  them thinking of us......    I am learning that some venues are great for "meetups" , and some others are not the greatest.   The   "Copacabana"  is a great venue for a meetup because there is a space for sitting and eating, and  talking and an adjoining space for music, mixing and dancing.   Everyone is free to move around .......... and the food is FREE  (before 8:pm).

"THANKSGIVING CELEBRATION PARTY"
WITH BUFFET DINNER & DANCING

Come celebrate the holiday with friends,
old and new! Meet, Mingle, dine & dance!
Come alone or bring a friend!

SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 28th, 2015
6:30 PM – 10:30 PM

At the legendary, world-famous
"Two-Room Rooftop Level"
@THE COPACABANA
268 West 47th Street
(Corner of 8th Avenue, NYC)

*FREE HOT BUFFET DINNER (6:30 PM-8:30 PM)
Delicious Fresh Cuts of Turkey
Big Variety of Hot Chafing Dishes
Delightful Desserts

*DJ & DANCING
Great Dance Music from the '50's to present
*Freestyle *Disco *Hustle *Swing *Salsa *Slow

*TWO BIG ROOMS
One for conversation & mingling and
one for dancing & mingling

ATTIRE: Holiday Stylish
(No blue jeans, no sneakers)

General Admission: $20
***BUT GET IN FOR JUST $15 BEFORE 8:00 PM***
***WITH PRINTOUT OF THIS INVITE FOR OUR MEETUP
MEMBERS AND THEIR GUESTS**
(one person per each printout)

results.description:
David Lynch wades through dark waters in his adaptation of Frank Herbert's cult science fiction novel. In condensing Herbert's rambling and complex book by eliminating characters and compacting events, Lynch succeeds in rendering the story incomprehensible to those unfamiliar with the novel and making the film look like a sketchy greatest hits collection of the book for Herbert fans. The story takes place in the year 10,191. The universe is governed through a system of feudal rule, presided over by Padishah Emperor Shaddam IV (José Ferrer), who appears to take his marching orders from something that resembles a talking vagina. In the kingdom are two rival houses -- the House of Atreides and the House of Harkonnen. Each house is trying to gain dominion over the universe, but that dominion can only be gained by the house that controls the Spice, a special substance that permits the folding of time. The Spice is only available on the desert world of Arrakis, or Dune. Shaddam, tired of the feuding between the two houses, permits the Atreides to take over the Spice production on Dune, while secretly working with the Harkonnens to launch a sneak attack on the Atreides and destroy them. The leader of the Atreides is Duke Leto (Jürgen Prochnow), who rules with the help of his concubine Jessica (Francesca Annis) and son Paul (Kyle MacLachlan). The rival Harkonnens are headed by the pus-oozing degenerate Baron Vladimir Harkonnen (Kenneth McMillan, in a thoroughly through-the-roof performance) and his two unsavory nephews, Rabban (Paul L. Smith) and Feyd (Sting). When his father is murdered by the Harkonnens, Paul escapes to Dune, where he is greeted by the Fremen (the desert dwellers on Dune who prepare the Spice) as the messiah foretold in Fremen legend. Paul assumes the mantle of messiah and leads the Fremen in a revolt that topples the balance of power in the universe.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hzUlXEyvJeA

Tour the Metropolitan Museum of Art

You want a highly-academic, highbrow tour of the Metropolitan Museum of Art where we stand before the great masters, contemplating their skilled use of line and form, while simultaneously placing them in the pantheon of other art historical geniuses, right?

You picked the wrong tour.

Welcome to Museum Hack VIP, our premiere museum experience.

Perfect for a date night, an evening with friends or a capstone to a New York City visit, our famous VIP tour guides will show you the secrets, backstories and hidden nooks and crannies of the Greatest Fucking Museum on Earth.

This “by New York City residents, for New York City residents” tour will show you the Met like you have never seen it before. On a Museum Hack VIP tour, you can expect:

Customization: we pick our favorites and mix them with your interests to make a totally custom tour. 
A fast pace: we see twice as many objects as a standard museum tour. 
Intimacy: The smallest group size of any tours of the Met. 
Photo ops: Instagram-worthy shots to wow your friends. 
Drinks: A glass of wine will be served, but be ready to drink it fast. 
And plenty of surprises along the way.

Intimacy: The smallest group size of any tours of the Met. 
Photo ops: Instagram-worthy shots to wow your friends. 
Drinks: A glass of wine will be served, but be ready to drink it fast. 
And plenty of surprises along the way.
results.name: VIP Night Tour at the Metropolitan Museum of Art

results.description:
The winner of the Golden Lion at the 2014 Venice Film Festival...

En duva satt på en gren och funderade på tillvaron (A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence).
2015. Directed by Roy Andersson.  101 min.

The winner of the Golden Lion at the 2014 Venice Film Festival, this is only the third feature in 14 years by the singular Swedish filmmaker Roy Andersson (Songs from the Second Floor, You the Living). Told through a series of almost motionless tableaux and staged on elaborate trompe-l’oeil sets that simulate vertiginous perspectives and geometrically impossible spaces, the film is Andersson’s wry retelling of Don Quixote, with the gallant knight and his loyal aide reimagined as a pair of traveling practical joke salesmen. Flashbacks take us from a glum, denatured present to an all-too-vivid past that includes references to Sweden’s position in World War II, hideously inventive colonial atrocities and a 1709 military defeat that marked the end of Sweden’s global ambitions. But for all of the film’s sense of horror and despair, Andersson’s wit and compassion shine through.

http://www.moma.org/calendar/events/1549?locale=en

For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing

Be advised that MoMA members can now reserve tickets 2 weeks in advance which makes many films sell out. THIS IS ONE THAT MAY SELL OUT.

You can reserve a ticket online.

If there's interest dinner will follow at the Thai restaurant across the street.



IMPORTANT.  READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people.  If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it may be cancelled if less than five people RSVP for it.   If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation.   Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5938 is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT:  Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Garden City Bowl 987 Stewart Ave, 

Garden City, NY 11530

WHO: 


Single men : ages 39-54 


Single women: ages 37-52 

How it works 

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.  

DRINK SPECIAL:  $8 Grey Goose Cocktails

Please visit http://www.weekenddating.com/bowling.shtml for full details on this special format and scorecard matching

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
Renowned caller Will Mentor will call a lively program of contras accompanied by The Gotham Gals!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Will Mentor and The Gotham Gals!

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party. It's a fun, new way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Free Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party. It's a fun, new way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Free Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Nov-28-2015_at_0800PM

This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Saturdy, 11/28/15. NO COVER. NO DRINK MINIMUMS. NEW FRIENDS. AND FREEEEEE PIZZAAAAA! No kidding! Free pizza! And free friends. Or B.Y.O.F. The more the merrier.


And yes, there will most likely be a lot of singles :)

Doors open at 7:45pm. Shows starts at 8:15-ish pm. Though it IS OK if you arrive late. We will be in the bar that's on the lower level. Show ends at 9:45-ish pm. Then time to make new friends while enjoying FREEEEEEE PIZZA!


****************** IMPORTANT***********************
PLEASE RSVP SO WE KNOW HOW MUCH
FREEEEEE PIZZZZZZA TO ORDER
******************************************************* 

Checkout these reviews from recent meetups:

"Last night was a great first experience. Good comedy, Free pizza and some wonderful conversation. Looking forward to the next time :)"

"Went by myself but had a great time meeting new ppl..would come back anytime:)"

"Good time..and FREE pizza! Can't beat that in NYC! Looking forward to more comedy shows from ya'all!!!"

"I had a great time! Everyone was friendly so going by yourself is okay- you will meet people!"

"It was pretty cool. Would totally go again"

Here's highlights from recent New York Comedy Fans meetups:

results.description:
Fuákata Cuban Salsa Social in Times Square at 151 W46th Street b/t Bdwy & 6th Ave - 11th Floor.

Join us in dancing off that Turkey feast! The night kicks off at 8pm with an intro lesson for non-dancing friends as well as a specialized workshop open to advanced dancers covering Casino Triples (one leader/two followers).

Live música cubana by Salsondria & DJ Madd Maracas spinning Timba in between sets.

8pm-2am: (Lessons + Live Music) $20
9pm-2am: $15
results.name: Cuban Salsa Social 11/28 in Times Sq: Lessons, Live Band, & DJ!

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network at over 15 of their partner social and singles groups. The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually  attending.  If you have any questions, please contact the event organizer at [masked].

This event features the best elements of a Match Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss. The World Bar has a cozy atmosphere that is casual, comfortable and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials till 9pm

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-Complimentary Appetizers 8-9pm

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)

Can I come alone?Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission: $15 in advance $20  at the door.
results.name: Singles Mix, Match & Mingle: NY"s Most Casual, Comfortable & Fun Single Party

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

Join Us At The Beautiful "Pure Lounge" For A Saturday Night Mixer On Nov 28th!

We'll Have A Reserved Area For The Group To Mingle At. You'll Also Have Access To The Main Bar And Dance Floor Area.

There Will Be A Fun Emoji Icebreaker Match Game From 8pm To 10pm (While Supplies Last) Find Your Emoji Match And The Lady Wins A Prize! 20 Ladies Prizes Available.

Members Will Be Given A Wristband Upon Entrance. This Will Give You Access To Select Drink And Appetizer Specials Till 10pm. Just Show Your Wristband To Server/Bartender.

25% Off Your Food Bill If Your Having Dinner. Show Your Wristband. Valid From 8pm To 10pm. Steak, Seafood & Full Sushi Bar Available.

DJ Frankie Vazquez Will Get Going At Around 10pm.

$5 Cover. 6 Meetup Groups & Many Non Meetup Singles Also Attending.

Looking Forward To Another Fun Night @ Pure Lounge!

results.description:
Come Join Us At The Beautiful "Pure Lounge" For A Saturday Night Party On November 28th!

We start meeting as early as 8pm and party til late. Pure Lounge is located off Route 46 East in the town of Parsippany NJ. Just look for the Pure Sign to know where to enter.

We'll have a Reserved Area for the group to mingle at. You'll also have access to the main bar and dance floor area.


There Will Be A Fun Icebreaker Match Game From 8pm To 10pm (While Supplies Last) Find Your Match And The Lady Wins A Prize! 20 Ladies Prizes Available.

Also Members Will Be Given A Wristband Upon Entrance. This Will Give You Access To Select Drink And Appetizer Special Til 10pm. Just Show Your Wristband To Server/Bartender.

$4 Beers, $5 Sangria, $6 Martinis, And Other Mixed Drink Specials.

25% Off Your Food Bill If Your Having Dinner. Use Code Word "Meetup" Or Show Wristband. Valid From 8pm To 10pm.

DJ Frankie Vazquez playing classics, top 40, and more upbeat dance music to get you moving and grooving starting at about 10pm.


$5 Cover Til 10pm For Meetup Members & There Guest.

Cover May Be Higher Afterwards.


Free Parking In There Huge Lot.

Multiple Meetup Groups Will Be In Attendance.

Pure Lounge Is Located Off Route 46 East In Parsippany NJ.

results.description:
Do you love Music and hate being bored especially on a Saturday night....no worries we got you .. come out for a great night of hip-Hop music, performance, partying and get on TV !

WHAT - "Bruse Wane's Album Release Party & Earl Manaigault Of Rap Concert" with performances by Bruse Wane, Fam-Illy, and other top indie artist and guest appearences. Bruse Wane's Earl Manigault Of Rap Album Drops Nov, 23 featuring Hip-Hop Legend Sean Price & Big Pun's Son Chris Rivers & November 28th we celebrate this great event in Hip-Hop with an awesome show and after party. Hosted & Covered by the Legendary Ralph McDaniels Of Video Music Box TV

Hosted By- Video Music Box, Wane Enterprises & The Frat House

Where: Saturday November. 28th in NYC, @ The West End Lounge a great live music venue in upper Manhattan. The West End is located at 955 West End Avenue NY, NY 10025 Cross Street 107th Between Broadway and Westend Avenue. The West End offers all night drink specials and delicious food.

Bruse Wane: Is A New York native.. Bruse Wane has worked with artist such as Sean Price, Styles-P, N.O.R.E., Remy Ma, Papoose, Keith Murray and more.. Bruse Wane.. is known for his high energy shows. He will be performing his banging songs, Beast Inside, Hercules, & BAM BAM, The Greatest, and more..We are offering special early bird ticket pricing for all that attend this show.. Bruse Will also be debuting the last verse Sean Price ever laid down with him on the song Venom.. Get your special priced tickets here 50% reduced Now for a limited time only ! Watch the trailer and get tick options at the link:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/earl-manigault-concert-bruse-wane-album-release-party-hosted-by-video-music-box-tickets-19422256492

results.description:
Hey Guys! I thought it would be fun to all meet up at the comedy show I produce at QED. If you haven't been to QED it is a great space for all different kind of events. During the day they have cool classes like swing dancing and knitting. In the evening QED is a performance venue. QED serves beer, wine and snacks. They also have THE BEST hot apple cider you will ever taste.

This is a great chance to make new friends and to hang out with some old friends. A bunch of my friends (all different ages) come to this show as well as locals and comedy lovers. We also have an Instagram photo contest. Whoever takes the coolest photos of the event and posts them on Instagram with #hashtagcomedy will win TWO free tickets to an upcoming show! We will chose 2 winners the Monday after the show!

I hope to see you there!!

Hashtag Comedy invites some of the best comics to comment on today's hottest issues. We choose the funniest up and coming stand ups to dissect the trending topics of today's world. The show is a great opportunity to laugh and learn. So come out and buckle up its going to be a wild ride!

Doors are at 8:45
Show is 9PM!

$10 at the door or you could buy online here:

http://qedastoria.com/collections/shows/products/hashtag-comedy-5 JC Knows Best(Church)
Steve Nowicki(Sirius XM)
Fredric Goldstein ( Last Stop Laughs)
Petey DeAbreu (Petey's World)
Christopher Guardino (Those Kids, The Breaking Kayfabeival)
Luke Mones (Funny or Die, Elite Daily)
Tracey Carnazzo ( Hashtag Comedy)
Tyler Richardson(NY Comedy Festival)
Travis Grant
results.name: Hashtag Comedy at QED

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

   After 9 months and 18 races,  the 2016 Formula One season concludes with the season finale this weekend at the Yas Marina track in Abu Dhabi. 

THE TRACK -  Formula One's only day/night race is held at the 3.45 mile Yas Marina track that has three distinct sectors; The fast and flowing corners of the first sector ends in a hairpin that gives way to a second sector consisting of two long straights which end in heavy-braking corners. The twisty final sector features a complex of low-speed corners that require good aero grip and balance. The day-night nature of the race presents an interesting technical challenge for the teams because the track temperature drops by as much as 15 degrees when darkness falls.

TYRE ALLOCATION -  Pirelli will be bringing the two softest tires in the range - soft and super soft tires for Abu Dhabi, the same combination last seen in Russia due to the smooth asphalt.

TALKING POINTS - Can Rosberg continue to hold-off Hamilton for another win in Abu Dhabi to make it 3 in a row? Can Lewis bounce back and finish the season in style at the Yas marina track? Can Vettel lead the resurgent Ferrari team for one more win this season?

If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 8:00am EST with the pre-race starting at 7:30am.

We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2015 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

Bob Wachtel leads our group reading; our new book is "Natural Meditation" by Dean Sluyter, a co-founder of our sangha. This is an excellent introduction to the type of meditation we practice, and also helps current meditators go deeper. You do not need to read in advance or even own the book to participate. We focus on reading the text aloud and absorbing its meaning for us at that moment. Contact Bob for further information.

This group segues into our usual meditation at 9AM at the same location.

Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
8:30am, Starbucks in Sunnyside; 10:00–11:00 minute pace.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short. If you're a faster runner, please study the route in case you wish to run ahead.  

Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.

results.description:
Mohonk Preserve - The Labyrinth - Lemon Squeeze - Great Views and Scrambling

This hike is one of the most beautiful and interesting hikes in lower New York State. The views are magnificent and the hiking and rock scrambling are great. You don't want to miss this one.

This is an intermediate level hike with a few steep uphills, and lots of rock scrambling. I suggest you bring gardening gloves to protect your hands.

Length: 8-10 miles

Skill Level: Intermediate

Organizer: David Klein

Phone:[masked]

We will meet at the visitor's center and hike along Undercliff Road. Here we should be able to see the rock climber's hanging off the cliff above. We then climb up the crevices of Giant's Workshop.

Afterwards, we turn left onto the red Arching Rocks Path (walking under the impressive cliff overhangs). Then turn right onto the blue Cathedral Path.

We then climb up the crevices of the cliff face. At the top, we stop for one of the most breathtaking views in the Gunks. We then climb up through the boulders to the top of Eagle Cliff. Turn right onto Eagle Cliff Road. Admire the great views of Lake Mohonk, the Mohonk Mountain House, and Sky Top from the many summerhouses along the cliff edge.

We then begin the famous Labyrinth trail. We climb up the ladders and through the crevices and caves at the base of Sky Top. Finally, we squeeze up through the "Lemon Squeeze." If you're up to the 101 steps, you can climb up to the top of the tower and admire the view of six states.

RSVP Details: If planning on attending, please write in comments of your RSVP if you are driving and from where or needing a carpool. Please update your RSVP if you cannot attend at least a day prior to event, unless an emergency.

Directions:

To reach the Visitor Center located at 3197 State Route 55, Gardiner, NY, take the New Paltz exit 18 off of the NYS Thruway. Go 7 miles west (through New Paltz) on Route 299 to the end: make right on Route 44-55 and then 1/2 mile to the Visitor Center on right. If that lot is full, continue a few hundred yards farther up hill to the entrance to additional, overflow parking lots at the Visitor Center. There is a $12 per person entrance fee unless you have an annual pass.

Required Gear: - Standard day-hiking gear including decent hiking boots, gardening gloves, a change of socks (remember your sunscreen, wind breaker, and possibly hat) - 2.5 liters of water. - Lunch and snacks.

Guidelines if carpooling: Passengers share all the gas and tolls. Please don't make the driver ask for money.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

DESCRIPTION:


Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  8 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

WEAR:
Sport cloth and sneaker.

BRING:
Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.
PS.If you don't have a badminton racquet, you can rent one at the center for $4 per day and $20 deposit.

LOCATION:
New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below. 


TRANSPORTATION:
Subway: #7 train to Main St. Station, 10-13 min walk.

results.description:
</a>

Hi everyone,

Randall's Island is a player's heaven. it has gazillions of fields and open space. Make sure to check what field we will use on the map below. 

CARPOOL: Also, if you are driving, please carpool with other players. The meeting spot in Manhattan is 124th street and 2nd avenue 30 minutes before kickoff time.

BIKING: You can also bike there using the footbridge on 103rd street and FDR drive or you can use the RFK Bridge Walkway

A link to better view this map is here: <a href="http://files.meetup.com/526560/Randalls%20Island%20Fields%20Map.pdf">RANDALL'S ISLAND MAP

Please be at the field 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt. We will play for 1.5 hous and you can use cleats since it's a grass field. 


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 45-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use cleats or turf shoes. Cleats are recommended since it's grass.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and big goals-we rotate being goalie.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Click here for: Field Location Map.To see an aerial view of the field on Bing Maps: Aerial Map

DirectionsYou can get to Randall's Island by car, bus, walking or biking. Here is the link to the directions: Getting to Randall's Island

The best ways to get there are:


-Taking the A,C,D, 4,5 or 6 train to 125th st stop and walking or biking east over the RFK Bridge.

-Also, taking the M35 bus from the NW corner of 125th Street and Lexington Ave.

-Also biking across the Walk way located on 103rd street and FDR Drive.

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is grassso please bring cleats, sneakers or all terrain shoes.

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Nikon is one of the most recognized brands in the photography industry and their commitment to innovative cameras places them as an industry leader. Come by the store to learn more about Nikon's latest camera offerings and how they are right for you.

Come meet Nikon tech rep Alex Podstawski and get all of your Nikon technical questions answered. In-store from 10 AM – 3 PM. Alex Podstawski has been working as a Nikon Technical Representative since early 2012. At age 13 he began shooting on his first camera, a Nikon FE and has been working with light and cameras ever since. Working in the photo industry since age 16 and shooting weddings only two years later, Alex has gained experience uncommon for someone his age. His specialties include infrared and ultraviolet photography, portrait, landscape, wedding, event, wireless flash, and auto racing, among others. With years of experience working in photo labs and specialty stores, as well as a diverse professional career, Alex is eager share his knowledge and enthusiasm for photography at every opportunity. Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Due to overwhelming demand, we're doing this special Jets Meetup one more time! Tickets are extremely limited and will go quickly (last 3 sold out!) so get yours today - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/jets/dates/Nov-29-2015_at_1000AM

Join 30 Meetup members for a traditional all-inclusive tailgate party with food & drink... PLUS YOU WILL GO ONTO THE FIELD before the game!  No other group has an offer like this!  If you are a fan or not, seeing a live NFL football game in person is an awesome experience! 

Our tailgate party in the parking lot begins at 10am! If you have never tailgated before, it is one of the most unique people watching and social experiences you will ever have. 

We'll have burgers, dogs, chicken wings, sausage & peppers, chips, soda, beer, wine and all the fixings you need to get ready for the game. We will also make a vegetarian selection for those who would like.

results.description: service at North Church Queens starts at 10 am and goes till 11 am. then there is fellowship which i like to call snacks and a low key party. the gardens are beautiful to visit. the bible is read by someone in the congregation. passages are the same for many of the churches regardless of the denomination- some set calendar thing that many Christian Churches go by. we sing some songs which is fun cause our organist really rocks! then there is the sermon which are most often, very interesting. we say some prayers, get forgiven for our sins~ as we forgive others who sin against us. communion is every first sunday. it is bread and grape juice in those individual small plastic shot glass type things.
results.name: Go to Church!

Lunches, we can use 5-10 volunteers from 9:30am-2:30pm on weekdays

 and 5-10 volunteers from 10:30am-2:30pm on weekends

 for food preparation, sorting/organizing incoming food and clothing donations, meal setup, serving one lunch meal and general cleaning projects.

Dinner service can only use 5-8 volunteers from 4:30-7:30pm on weekdays and 5-8 volunteers from 4:30pm-7:30pm on weekends - one meal / clean up

 Volunteers must be over the age of 15.

  Additionally, we offer the opportunity for corporate groups to donate the operational price of one meal—around $500. This contribution provides[masked] meals for homeless families and individuals across the city of New York. Executive Assistant to the Chief Program Officer
& Volunteer Scheduling Coordinator

227 Bowery, New York, NY 10002

results.description:
Come, join this free session and learn the fundamentals of practicing yoga. This class is good for a beginner or anyone who is looking to take a gentle yoga class, and have some fun while doing it!

There will be a short introduction in the beginning explaining what yoga is and how it works, followed by light stretching, breathing exercises, and meditation.

All you need to bring is:

- some loose fitting clothing- that you can comfortable move in

- an empty stomach- no food preferably 2-3 hours before class

You may bring your own yoga mat if you have one. If not, we have mats here that you can use.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

-Komal

Come with your stories and an open mind!

Bring a friend and stay for coffee and great conversation. We look forward to seeing you!

The High Line is a beautiful walking park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets on Manhattan’s West Side. We will get a birds-eye view of the Meatpacking District, Chelsea Park, Gallery District. See art displays, street performers and so much more along the way...

And it’s one of the safest tours in New York!

Our favorite tour guide Ike (former NYC Detective)

has a wealth of knowledge about NYC history and will educate us about this location. *ALSO YOU WILL RECEIVE a FREE BOOK COPY of Ike's Book on all the secret locations in NYC!

Walking tour last

approximately 1 -1/2 hours, about 2 miles total.

WEAR SNEAKERS

or very comfortable walking shoes! Relatively easy walk, some inclines.

Food not included

But we will have an opportunity to dine together at a restaurant on 14th St. that will provide our group with lunch at a discounted price! (Optional)

CLICK HERE pay $19 for tour

$25 CASH option day of event

EMAIL RSVP

*Limited to 25 in group- Buy Tickets Early

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/teachout.jpg?itok=Eyh2-T6W  Zephyr Teachout

Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader presides 

Teachout argues that the original sin in modern American thinking is the separation of economic and political power as fields of study, categories of news, categories of thought. 

Zephyr Teachout is an author, organizer, educator, and scholar. She is a constitutional and property law professor at Fordham Law School, and a deeply experienced leader in the fights for economic and political equality and against concentration of wealth and control in the hands of the few. 

Teachout is best known for her efforts to limit the influence of money on politics. Her arguments were cited in the Citizens United case by Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens. She is one of the leading legal experts on corruption. She has worked on political campaigns at every level, culminating thus far in a 2014 campaign for New York Governor.   

After the market crash of 2008, Teachout co-founded a group dedicated to breaking the power of Wall Street banks. After graduating law school at Duke, she founded a criminal defense nonprofit in Durham, NC, where she helped lead the fight against the death penalty. It was during these years Zephyr came to understand that lawmaking is not a science but rather a moral and political art.  

It is with this in mind that Teachout published her first book in 2014, Corruption In America: From Benjamin Franklin’s Snuff Box to Citizens United, discussing the trend of loosening restrictions on campaign finance and warning that “we could lose our democracy in the process.” Teachout is also a notable antitrust and environmental activist.   

Teachout grew up and attended public school in rural Vermont before going on to Yale. Her first job after Yale was as a special education teacher's aide in a small rural public school.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.name: Sunday Meeting: Original Sin in Modern American Thinking

results.description: One of my goals for this group is to gather for conversations about our lives as single, divorced, women in mid-life. Although being divorced, or even being older, doesn't define us, it can influence how we go about our lives, what we think about, how we are perceived by others and what we strive for. I would love to have conversations with other women about these issues.
results.name: Coffee and Conversation (Women only)

results.description:
Brooklyn Museum приглашает Вас познакомится с работами Francisco Oller.

Мы так же посетим раздел американской и европейской живописи.

Francisco Oller - eдинственный латиноамериканский художник сыгравший значительную роль в развитии импрессионизма.

Francisco Manuel Oller y Cestero родился в Пуэрто Рико. Учился живописи в Royal Academy of San Fernando в Испании.

В Париже его учителями были 

Thomas Couture, Gustave Courbet.  

Francisco Oller также обладал великолепным голосом. Его баритон звучал в местной итальянской опере.

Работы Oller выставлялись на равне с работами таких импрессионистов как 

Bazille, Renoir, Monet, Sisley.

В числе учеников Oller некоторое время был Paul Cezanne.

Oller основал в Пуэрто Рико Академию Исскуств.

Правительства Испании и Пуэрто Рико  высоко отметили заслуги художника.

Ваши знания живописи и замечания будут очень полезны

Берите детей :-)

The painter Francisco Oller contributed greatly to the development of modern art in both Europe and the Caribbean and revolutionized the school of painting in his native Puerto Rico.

Directions:

https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/visit/directions/
results.name: Impressionism and the Caribbean: Francisco Oller and His Transatlantic World

results.description:
The first "Thanksgiving" dinner happened here in 1621 after a successful harvest in which Pilgrims and Indians shared the feast. Indians introduced the Pilgrims to corn. So why wasn't this just like Munch With The Bunch at BSEC? What happened to bring about this moment of compassion between two groups of people who could overcome their fear of each other's differences and come together? An experiential piece to this workshop may suggest some answers.

Sarah Zahnstecher is a member of BSEC and a Licensed Creative Arts Therapist working in Park Slope, Brooklyn. She has led many different kinds of workshops, including a previous one right here.
results.name: Workshop: Harvesting the Highest Good  With Sarah Zahnstecher

results.description:
Rendezvous point 1  PARKING LOT approximately 10 to 12 dollars to park 10:15 am 129 Columbus Ave Jersey City NJ

Rendezvous point 2 Top of steep escalators at 11:00 am World trade center path

Rendezvous point 3 subway stop at W86th and Central park West A TRAIN LOCAL 11:40

Rendezvous point 4 The Obelisk 1 pm

That gives you plenty of options to join us. 

Please do not be shy

This is a Holiday walk with exercise . Please come and have some wine and cheer. Find some mistletoe and or just laugh. God knows we all need to laugh. 

The Obelisk, Turtle Pond, the Shakespeare Garden (with quotes and flowers mentioned in the plays), Belvedere Castle, with its panoramic views, and the Ramble (38 acres of winding wooded trails)  7 miles all together. It will be cold  I hope and we will walk  at a very moderate pace, mostly in the sun, and with quite a few stops to enjoy our surroundings.  We will start walking  from the Trade center to the subway E train switching to the A train and exiting at the central park west  and 86th st South East corner and to Central Park (approx @ 11:45) . From there we will walk briskly through the Park We'll end up at Rock Center around 4 pm with lunch or dinner at a restaurant close to Rockefeller center to begin the Holiday cheer. -- budget around $30 . 

I am going to try to plan to go to a healthy restaurant- Korean Veggie? . Suggestions welcome. 

Best Place to Park is on Columbus Ave Parking Lot in Jersey City NJ near intersection of Grove St and Columbus

 Please call  [masked] or email me to make sure that we do not leave you behind. If you are late we can easily rendezvous at a city point. Consider this your holiday walk  Bah Humbug.
results.how_to_find_us: World Trade Center Path train at top of escalators or meet us at another point in city
results.name: Some highlights of Central Park NYC,  (7 miles) Rockefeller Center Tree

group.name: Hiking, Camping, Walking, Outdoor Single friends 40+ Meetup

venue.name: Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description: The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

The High Line is a beautiful walking park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets on Manhattan’s West Side. We will get a birds-eye view of the Meatpacking District, Chelsea Park, Gallery District. See art displays, street performers and so much more along the way...


And it’s one of the safest tours in New York! Our favorite tour guide Ike (former NYC Detective) has a wealth of knowledge about NYC history and will educate us about this location.

The Welcome Table strives to go beyond food by also providing guests with assistance in obtaining entitlement benefits, free chiropractic treatments, HIV testing and counseling, and voter registration drives.

There are slots available for up to fifteen volunteers to prepare and serve food in a soup kitchen. We will be serving between 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

There’s nothing like giving back and paying forward to make you feel like you spent your day doing something worthwhile.

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Building Relationships

This Improve with Improv workshop will focus on building relationships. The key to relationships is being fully present, validating others, and building trust.

You will learn techniques that will help you to shift your focus from yourself to others. Listening to and  reacting to your scene partner(s) will be practiced through exercises, games and scene work.  You will discover that when you focus on others and remove your ego from the equation, that you actually become much more interesting, creative and spontaneous.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations. 


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV

Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


Suggested Donation: $15*

*free drink with $15 donation

**most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 or more per session**
results.name: Building Relationships

group.name: Improv for Actors - Workshops in Park Slope, Brooklyn

results.description:
Futsal on Sunday afternoons.

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

There will be TWO sessions of 1.5 hours each starting at 12pm for the first session and at 2pm for the second. You will have a chance to RSVP for both. 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins a match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group. Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. No goalies, so no goalkeeping.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ---------------------------------------------------

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Habran DOS sesiones de 1.5 horas cada una comenzando a las 12pm para la primera y 2pm para la segunda. Tendras la oportunidad de reservar para las dos. 

Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

No hay porteros, asi que no se puede porterear.

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of 37th Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn (use 4th Avenue entrance)
results.name: Let's do this!!! - Vamos a Jugar!!!

results.description:
Sugar Hill Market x La Maison d'Art at 259 West 132nd Street, just east of FDB/8th Avenue. HB will continue with curating Sugar Hill Market for Fall 2015 . 

Harlem's popular brownstone market will be indoors with two floors of designers and artisans who create everything from fashion, home furnishings, beauty products and artisan foods from local resources.

Uber cool insider website Thrillist  and AM New York has listed Sugar Hill Market as one of the best events in NYC to attend for 2015 but many uptowners already know that! 

The HB curated boutique market has had some great word of mouth and also awesome shout outs by New York Magazine, Time Out, and New York Daily News in the past. SHM is now on a Holiday schedule with consecutive weekends plan for the upcoming months.

The local popup also features new artwork exhibits hanging on the gallery walls which have been popular with collectors visiting the market.

RSVPs- Give 24 hours notice if you can't go.
Payment: Bring exact change + 18% tip & 7% tax or pay by credit card. A pricing list will be circulated, you submit payment for what your order was.
Menu: see www.royalwarsaw.com

"Quality of food means quality of life. For us this quality also means being attached to our roots and our Polish cuisine. This is our philosophy. Meat from healthy breeding, fresh field vegetables, garden fruits, and fish from clean waters; cuisine that is honest and simply tastes good."
