results.description:
NOTE: the walk is this Sunday, november 29th, not December 27th!

We'll start with a one-hour guided tour of the beautiful architecture and art of St. John the Divine, the fourth-largest church in the world. Next we'll eat lunch by a picturesque pond in Morningside Park. After lunch (dress warmly!), we'll tour Harlem: The Studio Museum (free on Sunday), several beautiful churches, the Apollo Theater, and some stately old blocks Finally we'll view the recently relocated home of Alexander Hamilton, built in 1801, and then tour the impressive Gothic architecture of City College.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED. 

DISTANCE: About 3 miles, ending at around 5:30. But you can leave earlier, of course.

PACE: Moderate, NOT SLOW.

LUNCH: Bring your own. We'll eat at around 2:10, outdoors in Morningside Park (dress warmly).

COST: $10 for the tour ($8 students and seniors); $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee.

TRANSPORTATION: Number 1 train (best) or C train (UPTOWN ONLY), both to 110th St. For details consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since the above sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check this link for weekend service changes: http://travel.mtanyct.info/serviceadvisory.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a red cap
results.name: Cathedral tour, Harlem highlights, Museum, & City College Gothic

results.description:
Great news! Time for another Tarot Party with Lorraine!  Read all about her below.

The cost is going to be $30 for a sample reading (aprox 15 minutes) but trust me she can get a lot of info to you in that amount of time and you are free to bring a recording device too! Mainly she will focus on what's going on around you right now and whats coming in the next few months. Knowledge is power and know that YOU always have the power to change what you see and do not like!

She is available to read from 1 - 5:00 pm. So please remember its VERY important to keep your RSVP's current. .As you arrive and pay I put you on the list and you are read in that order so if you arrive a little later it will still work out. No worries! *note* please come to side door not front door, and when its your turn you can either go down the inside or outside stairs to the basement.

I hope you can make it!  Love, Cassie

Lorraine Henrich

Since she was a child, Lorraine has been connected to the spiritual realms and her first dreams about the future of the planet occurred before she was five years old. In fact it was her visions that led her to her studies within the The Mystery school in 1998 where she has studied the ancient and sacred techniques of Healing Shamanism and psychism.

It is Lorraine’s mission to shift the collective consciousness by assisting others with the achievement of all goals including successful relationships with the self and others, heightened spirituality, self discovery, and manifesting joy in life.
She is also dedicated to restoring a sense of spiritual community and works on creating a strong foundation for others in many ways including; teachings on transformation Magick, Self Empowerment, and Success. Lorraine has studied all over the world in such remote locations as England, Japan, Tasmania, Australia, and South America. She teaches throughout the US, Canada, Ireland, The Caribbean South Africa, Brazil and Japan.

Her insightful mind and the ability to “direct channel” in the moment are abilities that make her unique in this work.Lorraine resides in NJ with her adorable cat. She holds a BA in English/ Education K-12 and has had several of her articles published in the USA and Canada. She is a Magister Templi, Kabbalah instructor,Celtic Shaman, High Priestess and initiated guide .

www.treeoflighthc.com <a>[masked]</a> [masked]

Services offered: Tarot, Psychic Readings, Etheric Surgery, 11th Codon Readings,En Sofic Ray Healing, Hermetic Soul Retrieval, Supernal Body Activation, Aura Cleansing, Enochian Healing, Kabbalistic Healing, Isis Healing, Laying of the Stones, Sylph Healing, Wand Healing, and Spiritual Counseling

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

JOIN US AS CAAF'S GOES AFTER THE MOST DESPICABLE FUR PEDDLERS IN NYC!

These are the animal abusers who thought they were under the radar, renting out locales throughout the city and brazenly promoting their animal carcasses by handing out postcards on street corners.

These animal abusers first met CAAF at the end of the 2011 Bergdorf march against fur/demo, when a small contingent of activists held an impromptu demo at their store. These cowards overreacted and locked the door. Unfortunately the millions of frightened injured trapped animals whose death they're responsible for, had no such barricade to save their lives.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHERE: The Fur Source of NY, 3 West 57th St. (between 5th & 6th Aves.), NYC

WHEN: Sunday, November 29th, 2015

TIME: 1:00pm ~ 2:30pm

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLEASE COME OUT FOR THIS DEMO! There is no ethical defense for what these people do. This store does not sell appliances, toys or some cruelty free clothing like our other targets. This is a furrier. They only sell fur. THIS IS PURE EVIL and they've been getting away with this UNCHALLENGED FOR FAR TOO LONG.

We need you to come to this demo.

It's time to send a message. FUR IS MURDER!

results.description:
Peggy Guggenheim: Art Addict

In her sophomore film, Lisa Immordino Vreeland (Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel) turns her lens on another grande dame of the art world with this vibrant profile of Peggy Guggenheim, the great expatriate art collector and socialite known for amassing the world’s foremost collections of modern art. As she moved through Europe and America during the cultural upheaval of the 20th century, Guggenheim battled personal tragedy and championed the work of many seminal artists. Mixing generous archival footage, interviews with some of the world’s finest art curators, and recently rediscovered audiotapes featuring a candid Guggenheim and her authorized biographer, Vreeland examines how her subject’s relationships with major masters—including Duchamp, Cocteau, Beckett, Pollock, and Rothko—were entwined with her passion for contemporary art. Peggy Guggenheim: Art Addict is a glimpse into the world of a colorful character, who was not only ahead of her time but also helped to define it. A Submarine Deluxe release.

Directed By Lisa Immordino Vreeland  97 minutes


TO BUY YOUR TICKET FOLLOW THIS LINK http://www.filmlinc.org/films/peggy-guggenheim-art-addict/

If there's interest, after the film let's have a coffee and share our opinions about it.
results.name: Peggy Guggenheim: Art Addict

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Please bring sun protection, water, comfortable walking shoes, and AN EXTRA LAYER OF CLOTHING.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. Although I will comment on some things (architecture and social history of these areas) along the way, this is not one of my walking tours.

This walk is about 5 miles and moderate paced (not slow paced). If you think that you will be lagging behind with a moderate pace, then this type of walk is not good for you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, the event host, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

Description:  We'll be walking through some of Jersey City's historic districts, including the neighborhoods of Hamilton Park and Van Vorst Park. These two neighborhoods have many surviving brownstones and townhouses that date from the Civil War period to the 1890s. One side street even resembles Brooklyn's Carroll Gardens neighborhood with leafy, spacious gardens in front of the townhouses. We will also see examples of "adaptive reuse" of old warehouses, horse stables, and churches that have been converted to apartment houses. And as we walk through these historic districts, we will see a number of murals that have been transforming Jersey City into an outdoors art gallery. In the middle of the walk, we will briefly stop outside of Historic Harsimus Cemetery where sometimes animals are roaming around. 

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM. 

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Duane Reade Pharmacy, which is just across the street from the PATH Grove Street Station in Jersey City, NJ. The address of Duane Reade Pharmarcy is 110 Newark Avenue. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Dunkin Donuts, MacDonalds and Starbucks, which are all near the Duane Reade Pharmacy.

Below is outside of the entrance to Duane Reade Pharmacy. 

Transportation (from Manhattan): You can take a NYC subway train (2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, or R) to the Fulton Center in lower Manhattan. Then walk a short distance and take the PATH subway train from the World Trade Center to Grove Street in Jersey City. This is just two station stops!

Transportation (from Manhattan): You can also take the PATH subway train (from Midtown or Greenwich Village) to Grove Street in Jersey City, New Jersey. From Midtown or Greenwich Village, you could take the PATH train from the following PATH stations: 33rd Street/6th Avenue, 23rd Street/6th Avenue, 14th Street/6th Street, 9th Street/6th Avenue, or Christopher Street (between Hudson Street and Greenwich Street.) Once in New Jersey, the PATH subway train will stop in Hoboken, Jersey City (Newport), and then Jersey City (Grove Street). Depending on where you get in the PATH subway system, the train ride can take up to 22 minutes.

The PATH subway fare is $2.75 each way. You can use a NYC paid-per-ride to pay the fare, but cannot use a NYC unlimited MetroCard or NYC Senior MetroCard.

A Senior PATH Smartlink Card (can download an application online) ride costs $1.00 each way if you are 65 years or older. 

Transportation (Driving): If you want to take your car to Jersey City, please call the telephone # in the link below to find out about the parking regulations on Sunday in Jersey City.

http://jcparking.org/

If you do take your car, you might want to park the car somewhere near the PATH Grove Street train station because we will be finishing the walk there.

Finishing Time/Place: This circular walk finishes about 5:00 PM at the PATH station in Grove Street, Jersey City. 

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Rainy weather, very cold or windy conditions cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, very cold or windy conditions, or the forecast is for rainy weather, very cold or windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice Sunday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post the cancellation on the Discussion Board.

Below are houses in the neighborhood of Hamilton Park, Jersey City.

Below is an apartment building that was once a church.

Below is inside of an apartment building that was once a major factory.

Below are houses in the neighborhood of Van Vorst Park, Jersey City.

Below is the Heppenheimer Mansion where more prominent citizens were once entertained here than anywhere in New Jersey. 

Below were goats hanging around Historic Harsimus Cemetery during the summer months.
results.name: Jersey City, New Jersey Walk (Nov. 29)

group.name: NYC/NJ Walks: Explore Architecture, Art, History & Sculpture

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson in the third chapter of his Wildpig Exclusive RPG "Sailing Against the Wind"! A great game for both new and returning players of 6th Level.

The crew of the Salty Cormorant, now united by shared adversity, have arrived at the open-sea trading city of Stilt-Sands, but all is not as it seems. The colors of the Eye blanket the town, and terrible creatures prowl the piers, ignored by the populace. Join the erstwhile pirates and sailors as they attempt to discover and uproot the source of such horrors.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Eye Over the Stilt-Sands

results.description:
Join DM James Walters in his first Wildpig Exclusive RPG! This is a great adventure for new players. There is a 6-player limit for this game.

The College of Garthun has prided itself on generating some of the greatest arcane masters in all of Reverat. Within its walls, the college possesses an artifact of immense power, the Arcane Vault, said to provide the school with an unlimited source of magical energy.

Recently, strange events have been taking place throughout the College of Garthun. Students and faculty have been reporting weird noises, and dark figures moving along the college grounds. Dean Thwarn has sent out the call for adventurers to investigate the strange happenings menacing his school. Can you solve the mystery of the Arcane Vault?
results.name: D&D 5e: Mystery of Arcane Vault

results.description:
// We'll meet in the lobby, right inside the 44th St. entrance. //

What's the best thing about meetup? What are the possible challenges? Is meetup a place to make friends? Or a platform for engaging with strangers on a deeper level? Which meetups work the best? Which don't? And what makes meetup attractive in a city like New York?


As a social anthropologist from Denmark, I am deeply fascinated by New Yorkers' continuous interest in connecting and sharing with new people. As part of my research on this exact topic, I would like to invite you to come share your experiences with meetups in New York City, and learn something about why the concept has become so popular here!

I hope to see you for an afternoon of sharing and discussion on the topic.

For any questions, feel free to write me.
/Ciara Coogan
results.name: A meetup about meetup! Host: Ciara

This is not transferable, you must attend the shoot
Refund Policy No refunds unless the shoot is canceled by streakarts.com
We will try to sell you place to another photographer and issue a refund minus a handling fee.
Lighting We use High Power Strobe Lights with radio trigger, we will provide a trigger for you camera (Some Sony cameras will not work with radio triggers) We also use daylight balanced continuous lights. They do not interfere with strobes

You may come a few minutes before your time and stay only a few minutes after.

Both a model release and the 2257 Compliance Forms will be provided.

Prices will rise as we get closer to the event and at the door

Come for a fun, relaxing after Thanksgiving Brunch at Sarabeth's.  They are famous for the their pastries and delicious brunches. 

http://www.sarabeth.com/

http://sarabethsrestaurants.com/park-avenue-south/

Sarabeth's Park Avenue South Restaurant - New York, NY /sarabeths-park-avenue-

Rating: 4.3 - ‎624 reviews - ‎Price range: $30 and under We serve Breakfast, Lunch, Tea, Dinner and Brunch in this great space.

5 stars Trip Advisor “Best eggs benedict ever” Reviewed November 13, 2015 NEW

Amazing experience, fine food top quality ingredients staff were very attentive. Was busy but they had plenty of staff working so you never had to wait for anything, very nice prosecco. Would definitely come here every morning for breakfast also made me want to come back and try the rest of the menu.

5 stars Reviewed October 15, 2015

We loved the food and ambience here! The Salmon Eggs Benedict was delicious.  The portion is big enough for 2, and the side salad is a nice touch. The lemon ricotta pancakes were as divine as they sounded- light, fluffy, and very flavorful. We also enjoyed their coffee, which was bold, strong, and plentiful. My friend also loved her mochaccino. Our server provided great service.

5 stars Reviewed August 3, 2015

We had an amazing brunch this morning! We made an OpenTable reservation and walked right past the crazy line outside. Highly recommend a reservation. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes and the hubby had the waffles. Both were amazing! Our waitress was super kind and did not rush us at all. Service was attentive even with the place being packed. We will definitely be back!

We look forward to seeing everyone.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
In the aftermath of the horrific events in Paris, French authorities have said they will not allow the massive march on Nov. 29, the day before the UN Climate Talks begin. Although the situation in Paris is fluid, marches and other climate activities around the world that same weekend will go on. More than 2,000 actions in 150 countries will take place – and we’ll be part of that international demand for climate justice here in New York City!

Please join us as we call on Mayor de Blasio to make strong commitments on climate before he goes to the talks in Paris. The climate crisis is real and NYC must take leadership by enacting policies that dramatically reduce our carbon emissions. NYC alone produces more greenhouse gas emissions than 97 countries!

We know it’s a holiday weekend when people often spend time with families. Let’s take a few hours on that Sunday to re-commit ourselves to our global family. Let us gather in a unified call against violence and hatred and for climate justice and peace.

Sunday, Nov. 29th – 2 pm
East side of City Hall,
on the plaza.
Bring your families and friends
Initiated by People’s Climate Movement NY
check for updates on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1656594291289536/
results.name: Global Climate March - NYC

results.description:
After the attacks in Paris, France has - understandably -  banned the Global Climate March from its streets. The more reason for us to march elsewhere, and send a message that we're serious about wanting climate action.


I encourage all members of Princeton's Climate Change Meetup to meetup at a climate march.

UPDATE: The Philadelphia march has been cancelled.

The New York March starts at 2pm, at New York's City Hall. Register to receive updates here:
https://secure.avaaz.org/en/event/globalclimatemarch/Global_Climate_March_NYC


Let's give proper thanks for what we enjoy in our lives by rallying for climate justice.
results.name: Global Climate March - New York

results.description:
Futsal on Sunday afternoons

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

There will be TWO sessions of 1.5 hours each starting at 12pm for the first session and at 2pm for the second. You will have a chance to RSVP for both. 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins a match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group. Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. No goalies, so no goalkeeping.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                     -----------------------------------------------------

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Habran DOS sesiones de 1.5 horas cada una comenzando a las 12pm para la primera y 2pm para la segunda. Tendrás la oportunidad de reservar para las dos. 

Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo activo, debemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. No hay porteros, asi que no se puede porterear.

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

results.description:
// We'll meet in the lobby, right inside the 44th St. entrance //

What's the best thing about meetup? What are the possible challenges? Is meetup a place to make friends? Or a platform for engaging with strangers on a deeper level? Which meetups work the best? Which don't? And what makes meetup attractive in a city like New York?

As a social anthropologist from Denmark, I am deeply fascinated by New Yorkers' continuous interest in connecting and sharing with new people. As part of my research on this exact topic, I would like to invite you to come share your experiences with meetups in New York City, and learn something about why the concept has become so popular here!

I hope to see you for an afternoon of sharing and discussion on the topic.

For any questions, feel free to write me.
/Ciara Coogan

Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

The evening's focus will be on "older," "more popular" games (such as Catan, Carcassonne, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Ticket to Ride, Power Grid, etc.) so that newer players can get a solid introduction to these new styles of board games. If your image of "board game" is Sorry, Life, Backgammon, Monopoly, Risk, etc. there's a whole new, better genre waiting for you! (Veteran games and gamers still welcome, of course.)

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

results.description:
Explore writing and creativity inspired by gentle movement, focused breathing, and relaxation. Learn techniques to release tension, move toward stillness, and tune in to your muse. The class includes several writing prompts following yoga postures. 

This is beginner-level workshop but open to all levels and new and/or experienced writers. 


-Wear comfortable clothing. Bring a pen/notepad. Bring a yoga mat (rentals available at studio). 

-$15 cash at door

-PARKING AVAILABLE at the municipal lot across the street off of Griffith. Location is a ten-minute walk from 9th and Congress Light Rail station. 

Workshop hosted by Adriana Rambay Fernández, RYT-200. A Kripalu-certified teacher, Adriana offers gentle and moderate classes that support the process of self-discovery and healing through guided meditation, asana, and pranayama. Through an open, receptive, and steady approach she guides students to a place of inner balance, harmony, and union. She believes yoga can unlock inner creativity, healing, and a deepened sense of awareness. Find out more about Adriana at:

 http://adrianarambay.com/

PRACTICAL USES OF SOUND AND MUSIC
TO RE-ENERGIZE YOUR LIFE!

Join Rev. Sandra Winter for this interactive workshop where you will learn:

• The healing power of music and sound and why you don’t have to be a musician to access that power

• How to use sound to increase your vital energy, minimize pain and stress and promote healing

• How to use sound to add power to your meditation and visualization time

• How to “tune” yourself up in the morning

• And much more

• We are requesting a "pay-what-you-want" donation for this workshop, with a portion of proceeds going to support the work of the United Palace House of Inspiration.


Rev. Sandra is an ordained Interfaith Minister, singer / songwriter, sound healing practitioner and inspirational speaker. She writes custom healing music and songs for individuals and businesses as well as doing individual healing and coaching sessions.

results.description:
MEETUP SPECIFICALLY FOR INTERMEDIATE PLAYERS
I've had request from some of you for a Meetup specifically for Intermediate Players. I would now like to announce a monthly meetup for intermediate players which will happen on the 4th Sunday of the month. The first will be on August 30th. We could call this one the "4th Sunday Acoustic Guitar Meetup." (And yes, I do realize that August 30th is the 5th Sunday in the month.  And after August 30th, we, will will do 4th Sundays of each month!!)


THIS 90-MINUTE SESSION will advance your knowledge and skill: You will expand your ability to read notes, learn to play a new song and work on playing with other musicians.

YOU KNOW YOU'RE INTERMEDIATE IF:
You are intermediate if you know how to play chords well enough that you can play songs with correct rhythm, you are able to read standard music notation to some degree, and perhaps you can read tablature. Maybe you've taken formal lessons from a teacher before.

BRING YOUR ACOUSTIC GUITAR TO PARTICIPATE.  No need to bring a music stand--Ripley-Grier supplies chairs and music stands for each participant..


COST:  $12.00 per person and must be paid at the time of RSVP.  NO WALK-INS.  You must be registered to attend.


MINIMUM # OF ATTENDEES: 4--We must have at least 4 people RSVP's "yes" at 48 hours before the event; otherwise the event will be cancelled.
results.name: INTERMEDIATE GUITAR PLAYERS Meetup-4th Sundays

results.description:
No preparation needed for this meeting! Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!
results.name: On-the-Spot Workshop Critique Group

results.description:
We are asking $5 when rsvp, and rest of $5 due at door. The change is to reduce the amount of no-show and be fair for people on the waiting list.

For advanced beginners (BB) and intermediate (A) players. We strongly recommend all recreational players and beginners (B) signing up for the clinics scheduled in April and May.

RSVP online to secure your spot. ONLY 6-10 SPOTS AVAILABLE. $10 payable at door.

STREET PARKING ONLY~ school remind me that our insurance does NOT cover parking lot.

Use the left side blue door to go inside. Find us on INSIDE COURT. (outside court is a church group).

Here is the our usual schedule:
3:15 pm: arrival, changing and stretching, warm up and passing practice. (while basketball is finishing up and net is being setting up)
3:30 pm hitting and servicing practice
3:45 pm game starts

Gym Rules:
- Up to 8 players per team; Cap at 3 teams, which is 24 players

- Once cap has been reached, any players coming after will wait opening spots (like someone left).

- Recreational player and beginner play (B) feel free to practice on the side of the court, which is TOTAL free. We're here to support each other so feel free to ask anyone to practice together.

Call or email us if any questions.

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.

results.description:
STARTING TIME : 4:40

ROOM tells the extraordinary story of Jack (Jacob Tremblay in a breakout performance), a spirited 5 year-old who is looked after by his loving and devoted Ma (Brie Larson, SHORT TERM 12, TRAINWRECK).  Like any good mother, Ma dedicates herself to keeping Jack happy and safe, nurturing him with warmth and love and doing typical things like playing games and telling stories. Their life, however, is anything but typical—they are trapped—confined to a windowless, 10-by-10-foot space, which Ma has euphemistically named “Room.” Ma has created a whole universe for Jack within Room.....

DINNER


MP Taverna

[walk from theater]

Roslyn, NY

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson in the third chapter of his Wildpig Exclusive RPG "Sailing Against the Wind"! A great game for both new and returning players of 6th Level.

The crew of the Salty Cormorant, now united by shared adversity, have arrived at the open-sea trading city of Stilt-Sands, but all is not as it seems. The colors of the Eye blanket the town, and terrible creatures prowl the piers, ignored by the populace. Join the erstwhile pirates and sailors as they attempt to discover and uproot the source of such horrors.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Eye Over the Stilt-Sands

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

Studio: Lionsgate

MPAA Rating: N/A

Genre: Drama, Action, Sci-Fi

TheHungerGamesmovie.com

The epic global phenomenon of "The Hunger Games" arrives at its powerful final chapter with "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 2" – in which Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence) now fully realizes the stakes are no longer just for survival, they are for the future. With the nation of Panem in a full scale war, Katniss Everdeen confronts President Snow (Donald Sutherland) in the final showdown. Teamed with a group of her closest friends – including Gale (Liam Hemsworth), Finnick (Sam Claflin), and Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) – Katniss goes off mission, using the unit from District 13 – and risking their lives – to stage an assassination attempt on President Snow increasingly obsessed with destroying her, the mortal traps, enemies, and moral choices that await Katniss will challenge her more than any arena she faced in The Hunger Games.

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:00pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

For this Sunday We start at 5:15pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <" class="linkified">http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>;; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Interested in a more practical hands-on understanding of the Kabbalah and specifically the Sephiroth? Come join us for our introductory and planning meeting for a new study group.  

We will be using "The Qabalah Workbook for Magicians: A Guide to the Sephiroth" by Anita Kraft  <a>(http://www.amazon.com/The-Qabalah-Workbook-Magicians-Sephiroth/dp/1578635357</a>;

) as our guide to a more thorough understanding of the Sephiroth of the Tree of Life along with other classic Kabbalah texts.   

During this meeting we will begin to review the Qabalah. We will also use this meeting to assign leaders for our upcoming workings.  
  If you cannot make this meeting, please reach out to indicate your interest in this study group so we can coordinate attendees as participation will be closed to group members only after the initial gatherings. 

To RSVP for this event and receive directions, please email

results.description:
Let's Gather in Gratitude!

Please join us for an evening of sharing, receiving and connecting...
Prepare to share about the good harvest of your Life. In a 'Gratitude Exchange' celebration. All participants write a few things they're thankful for this year, in life, within their heart - and put them in a 'mixing hat' to draw later at random. Hear your gratitude expressed by community, one by one... 

Vegetarian Fare - Please bring one vegetarian dish to share. Hot or cold. Please keep in mind, we don't have anything to heat or keep food cold in.

Open Mic Food Talk! - Open to Anyone that would like to share their knowledge of food (10min. or less per person). The floor is yours...What nourishes you? How has food played a role in your health? What have you learned from food that can help others? 

*Please send a message to Karuna if you'd like to participate so we can plan accordingly. :)

Venue donation $10.00

 We will provide all utensils, plates, napkins, cups and drinks.

Please feel free to stay for our Healing Circle and Soul Meditation @ 7pm if you'd like. 

Look forward to seeing you,
Karuna, Brian and Melanie
results.name: Gratitude Exchange Potluck!

Yerba Buena Perry- Cocina Latina
1 Perry Street @ Greenwich Avenue (off 7th Ave)
1 block South of 1,2,3 train @ 14th, 5 min from ACE
6-7 min walk from ABCDEFM @ West 4th.
Sunday, November 29th 
5:30 pm optional drinks, 6:30 pm dinner
$77 3-course, glass of wine, tax and tip
$68 no wine

You must RSVP and prepay at http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/yerba-buena-perry/ in order to attend. Thank you

Julian Medina, chef-owner of Toloache, Yerba Buena, Yerba Buena Perry, Toloache Taqueria and Coppelia, worked at Hacienda de Los Morales and Les Celebrites, in Mexico City’s Hotel Nikko in the 90’s, where Chef Richard Sandoval discovered him. So impressed was Chef Sandoval, that he insisted Chef Medina move to NYC where he appointed him ‘Chef de Cuisine’ of Maya. Eventually, Chef Medina became Corporate Chef for ALL of Richard Sandoval’s Mexican restaurants and opened and created the entire menu for Pampano. Chef Medina has also been Executive Chef at Sushi Samba, Zocalo, is a graduate of the French Culinary Institute and appeared on ‘The Iron Chef.” Upon opening Yerba Buena, New York Magazine named it one the best restaurants of the year. Zagat rated 22, stating, “Chef Medina delivers delectable, inventive Pan-Latin fare in a hot spot that stirs up a 1950's Cuba. Yerba Buena Perry transports guests to an exclusive club in Havana with a feel that is retro, yet chic and sophisticated.” NY Mag says, “Julian Medina adds Yerba Buena Perry to the portfolio that already includes one of the best restaurants in the Village, as well as Toloache.” Michelin guide says, “Yerba Buena Perry transports you to a South American paradise with Latin-inspired dishes. A longtime favorite, Executive Chef Julian Medina, mambos himself through the kitchens of not one, but six different restaurants, and this ‘oh so mighty restaurant’ takes the cake. Mixing Cuban Chilean, Peruvian and Mexican influences, the upscale Medina delivers a signature flavor where even familiar dishes have unexpected flair.”
results.name: Yerba Buena Perry

BUY TICKETS HERE

Quiet Events is bringing Sundays Back to life with “Quiet Sundaze”. This is a Monthly Caribbean Quiet Event Series that is being held at the beautiful and spacious D’Savannah bar & lounge; an indoor and outdoor facility, allowing the party to go on in any weather! This is our new Thanksgiving edition, with 3 DJs Spinning, so you know it’s going to get wild!

Your 3 DJs will be spinning:
DJ 1 (Blue): Soca/Dancehall
DJ 2 (Red): Hip Hop/Reggae/R&B
DJ 3 (Green): Caribbean Mix

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention
3 Areas to party in: D’Savannah Indoor/Outdoor & Crystal Manor Ballroom

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
Rain or Shine
Tickets are limited!

HOW IT WORKS

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Quiet Sundaze: Soca/Caribbean Party (Thanksgiving Edition)

Recently, I've discovered Abraham's teachings of the law of attraction and found it to be so inspiring to let the world know how the universe works based on your own thought. This information that we will be learning and discussing together is actully channeled through Ester Hicks from her spiritual guides. We will start from the beginning of the book till the end. Its not just about learning and understanding the principals, its about applying it to your life and getting the results you want from your life.

This is not about religion. Its about how the actuall law of attraction works based on your feelings and emotions. I am not an expert, I'm just going to guide and direct the group to keep a positive flow. Please leave all your negitivity at the door. Religion, sports and politics are NOT to be discussed. Adults only. there will be some refreshments served. Donations are wellcome to cover membership fees and refreshments.

Looking forward to meeting everyone.

When this happens a form of multi-dimensional healing occurs that becomes literally, spiritually, emotionally, physically, and even karmically transformational. Vortex Healing® works directly from the realm of divine consciousness. When you receive a healing you receive from a multitude of energetic and divine frequencies simultaneously. There are many levels to our consciousness, some containing the deepest and hardest to reach levels of negative conditioning, karma, and trauma. Vortex Healing® reaches all these levels. Vortex Healing® creates powerful and accelerated healing for the deepest of blocks, negative patterns and emotional trauma. It heals and transforms the very fabric of your reality. All negativity, disharmony, struggle, and even negative karma fall away to bring about incredible breakthroughs, freedom from the deepest of trauma, and a great opening to the flow of fulfillment and abundance. The divine frequencies used can reprogram core belief systems and negative emotional patterns that will bring more harmony and fulfillment both in your inner and outer reality. It also releases the illusion of separation consciousness, so each healing session brings you even deeper into your most highest divine expression. My Certification level is Merlin’s Grace, one the most powerful levels of the Vortex Healing®. I have been practicing in the West Village for 14 years.

On my level of certification I can heal up to 30 people at once. During the group healing I will introduce the many different healing frequencies to your system starting with: deep relaxation, energizing, healing structures, then the very profound core healing. Core healing will include a very intense karmic healing that afterwards will bring very powerful and magical transformational resolve of issues in ones inner and outer reality.

results.description:
Midnight's Children is a 1981 book by Salman Rushdie that deals with India's transition from British colonialism toindependence and the partition of British India. It is considered an example of postcolonial literature and magical realism. The story is told by its chief protagonist, Saleem Sinai, and is set in the context of actual historical events as with historical fiction.

Midnight's Children won both the Booker Prize and the James Tait Black Memorial Prize in 1981.[1] It was awarded the "Booker of Bookers" Prize and the best all-time prize winners in 1993 and 2008 to celebrate the Booker Prize 25th and 40th anniversary.[2][3] In 2003, the novel was listed on the BBC's survey The Big Read.[4] It was also added to the list ofGreat Books of the 20th Century, published by Penguin Books.
results.name: "Midnight's Children" by Salman Rushdie

results.description:
If you want to make the next year the best year, this is the time to start.  The best way to prepare your mindset for a successful and fruitful year is by toning your spiritual muscles now.  Spirituality is “life above self,” or life above ego.  It has been proven that when we cultivate a life above ego, we can accomplish great things.

History has also proven that all great men and women realized their dreams by maintaining Spiritual Fitness.  Spiritual Fitness can set you free.  It helps you fulfill your life purpose, overcome adversity, and enjoy your life to the fullest. 

However, most people struggle to find a Spiritual Fitness plan that works.  The reason is most spiritual practices in the market are quite ego-driven, even though they would call it self-reliance or self-development. 

For example, the usual spirituality starts with 1) It's all about basic goodness; 2) No one can do it for you, but you CAN do it; 3) It's all about the mind; 4) There's no God, but we are all gods, and you are a god when you attain enlightenment.

Such self-help model doesn't work because it puts too much burden on oneself to attain greatness. It subtly adds tremendous stress on those who practice it, and the long term effects are even worse—according to the British Journal of Psychiatry (January 2013), such people can develop mental illness.

Here's the right way to do it.  There are eight steps derived from the time-tested teaching of Jesus Christ that most churches will never teach you:

1) Consciousness -- You start with being aware of your ego state

2) Abandonment -- You overcome your ego

3) Rebirth -- You receive the benefits of the new life above ego

4) Edification -- You nurture your new life above ego

5) Forbearance -- You develop grace and mercy

6) Refinement -- You cultivate a pure heart

7) Enlightenment -- You shine your light to the world

8) Endurance -- You stand against the winds

Notice that the above eight steps form an acrostic CAREFREE because the result of this spiritual fitness plan is true freedom, happiness, and fulfillment. More than that, you will see miracles happening in your life because God promises to bless you when you walk this path.

That is how to go from being LOST to FULFILLMENT, from spiritual bareness to fruitfulness, from a stressful roller-coaster life to constant joy. 

And if you are serious about living a fruitful, fulfilled, and carefree life, join us for a four-week workshop on spiritual fitness during this Advent season.

WHEN: There are two options available:

·  Saturday AM Group: meets weekly at 10:00am – 11:15am, starting November 28, 2015

·  Sunday PM Group: meets weekly at 7:00pm – 8:15pm, starting November 29, 2015

WHERE:  Trinity Presbyterian Church, 650 Pascack Road, Paramus, NJ 07652

CONTACT: Sam Stone: email [masked],
or call Sam at[masked]-1133.

COST:  Free Will Offering (Suggested $80, or $20 for each class)

Sign up today and let’s make this new year the greatest year in your life!

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
Evidence supporting reincarnation, and do we remember our past lives? If not, why not?

AN ending is just a new beginning in disguise it’s been said. This perfectly describes the ancient belief in the soul’s immortality and continuity through reincarnation. The spiritual eye of light,(represented in the human brain by the pineal gland), is more and more activated as we progress through spiritual evolution’s wisely appointed reincarnations. Such stages are necessary to finally achieve “conscious god-hood,” in the words of Theosophical Pioneer W. Q. Judge, all the while living a human existence on Earth, Judge concluding: “Getting back the memory of other lives is really the whole of the process…” Mr.Judge in his Letter 5 also notes: “if some people don’t understand certain things, it is either because they have not got to that point in their other lives, or because no glimmer of memory has yet come.” Some people do have such glimmers, and as often such recalls have the power to heal, physically and emotionally.
results.name: Reincarnation and Karma, Q & A discussion

results.description:
How signing up works: First come first serve.

The Place: I found this place on Eater's 18 hottest Manhattan restaurants and figured the group might like it. It looks like the price point is a tad lower than a lot of the other places I post.

http://ny.eater.com/2015/10/26/9606398/pizza-beach-les#[masked]

With a firm focus on market driven, daily fresh ingredients and a menu that caters to vegans, vegetarians and locavores alike, Pizza Beach is a cool and welcoming Modern American restaurant exceptional in our food, drinks and hospitality experience.

Wood oven fired pizzas, house made pastas and healthy mains brimming with seasonal ingredients anchor the market driven menu alongside a 40 bottle wine list, all priced at $40 and a full bar with a fun signature cocktail list!

At Pizza Beach, New York meets Malibu with its unique 90s-retro beachside café vibe, lively with strings of lights draped from the wooden rafters and hanging ferns, cast open french doors and a summer al fresco cafe. Be it snowy or sweltering out, it's always, always sunny at Pizza Beach!

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Pizza Beach

KARMA is gracious enough to provide us their upstairs lounge complete with comfy sofas and large screen viewer with surround sound to watchTHIS SEASON's WALKING DEAD!!!

Karma will have dinner and drink specials just for us.  We usually watch the previous episode from 8-9pm casually with the lights up and discuss our theories and predictions about the show .

Then stay for the main event! Be warned: The lights go down and it will get pretty quiet once the 9pm episode begins.


WARNING: THERE MAY BE SPOILERS IN THE COMMENTS

THIS WILL BE THE LAST EPISODE UNTIL FEBRUARY!!!! Hope you can join us!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. It was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This weeks Host: Ayanna Dookie, Joe List (Comedy Central, Last Comic Standing), Gina Brillon (AXS TV), Ari Shaffir and Teddy Smith (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This show is for the 10pm show this week. if you would like to come for the 8, there will be an organizer who will give you tickets.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

Jae

All Ages - NYC

MEET at 11:30am Corner of 34th St. and 11th Ave

Look for me... Hot Pink Scarf with Clip Board

TAKE MY CELL # with you[masked]

FULL DIRECTIONS and DETAILS HERE 

The High Line is a beautiful walking park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets on Manhattan’s West Side. We will get a birds-eye view of the Meatpacking District, Chelsea Park, Gallery District. See art displays, street performers and so much more along the way...

And it’s one of the safest tours in New York! Our favorite tour guide Ike (former NYC Detective) has a wealth of knowledge about NYC history and will educate us about this location.

*ALSO YOU WILL RECEIVE a FREE BOOK COPY of Ike's Book on all the secret locations in NYC!

Walking tour last approximately 1 -1/2 hours, about 2 miles total.

WEAR SNEAKERS or very comfortable walking shoes! Relatively easy walk, some inclines.

Food not included But we will have an opportunity to dine together at a restaurant on 14th St. that will provide our group with lunch at a discounted price! (Optional)

CLICK HERE pay $19 for tour $25 CASH option day of event

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Beyond Reach.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Beyond Reach

results.description:
Click Here to see the new event site for updates , speakers, talks, and more!

(lots of special discounts too!)

Overview


We started this meetup group to bring new ideas to healthcare faster and we are proud to have been able to help hundreds of companies like Phreesia, Abilto, IHT Spirit, 1DocWay, Avado, and Blueprint Health gain the momentum they need to go from product to pilot to sales to changing healthcare. 

Now, for the first time we will have a whole day focused on helping 20 great companies attain the momentum they need to get to the next level.  Join hundreds of investors, partners, early adopters, hospital leaders, and patient leaders and help make the magic happen!

Got Momentum?  

If you have a great idea that is just getting going, building a little momentum and want much more, then this is the event for you.  Apply to make the pitch Finals on stage in front of 200 people and our massive online crowd following the livestream on MedStartr.tv and twitter (#MedMo15).  This is our largest prize package ever and it could exceed a $50,000 value but in truth, it is priceless.  That's because it is designed to include everything a startup with a great idea and a solid team needs to succeed.  It is still growing but so far includes:

• Awareness - Millions of impressions online and off that your company is ready for the big leagues (even making the finals is a big deal as you can see from our last big contest)

• Early Adopters - The audience is filled with people looking for great new ideas for themselves and their patients.  Speaking at H2NYC, going live on MedStartr, and winning our contests has started over 10,000 new customer relationships for early stage healthcare companies.  We can't guarantee it will happen, but it usually does.  See what happened to Interactive Health Technologies when they won in 2014.

• Partnership Opportunities - Top finishers will win at least one meeting with key Partners and Panelists (Aetna, Novartis, NYCSeed,...)

• Acceleration & Syndication - Acceptance into the 2016 MedStartr Acceleration Program that has helped companies like CareSync, Misfit Wearables, DocGraph, and Avado close over 200M in funding and may include investment and syndication from the MedStartr Fund

• Startup Services - Over $5,000 in key services has been donated by our generous sponsors like Sheppard Mullin already and is projected to exceed 10K

Keynotes, Panelists, and Speakers:

Over Twenty amazing panelists and speakers will be on hand to speak, ask the tough questions, and help judge the finalists.  Each judging panel will include a Patient, Provider, Partner, Institution, and Investor.  Think you have what it takes to be one of our Star Panelists?  Apply to be a Panelist and / or MedStartr Mentor here.


A few of our Panelists:

Susannah Fox (HHS), Regina Holliday (WalkingGallery), Ben Chodor (HealthTechTalk on iHeart Radio),  George Mathew, MD (Aetna),Dawn Bell (Novartis), Owen Davis (NYCSeed), Peter Frishauf (MedScape), Sarah Krug (Cancer 101), Mandi Bishop (Dell), Thomas Tsang (Cornell), Amy Cueva (MAD*POW), AJ Lociano (Truveris), Zach Silversweig (Cipher Health) and over a dozen more top healthcare innovation leaders will speak and be on Panels helping judge...

Four (Yes Four!) Pitch Contests in One Day

That's right, we are pulling together FOUR panels with 5 finalists each to take the stage and be judged by a panel of patients, providers, partners, institutions, investors and our crowd, online and off.  Prizes will include meetings with key partners and investors, a package of acceleration services, cash, and  investment / syndication with the brand new MedStartr Investment Fund.   Do you have the stuff to get on stage?  Apply here and find out!

Wearable Health Technology

From the fitbit IPO to millions of kids wearing the IHT Spirit monitors in Gym class, the IoT has come to healthcare in a big way this year.  Five of the highest potential new ideas in the space will vie to win our heartbeats and mindshare.

Hospital Innovations

Traditional high cost, high touch care centers are rapidly becoming centers of innovation with the help of hundreds of nimble tech teams.  Five of the top companies transforming this space will present to win!

Pharma Shark Tank

From smart pills to better deep analytics, few areas are changing as fast as Pharma.  We invite the five best new ideas in Pharma tech to show us how they will enable the New Pharma paradigms and change how we take our medicine.  The Panel will include potential investors, partners, and early adopters that can help make the best ideas take off!

Reinventing Clinical

Patients and Physicians have many new tools to engage and collect vast amounts of data. We invite the best new ideas to compete and show us what they have built that will reshape a brighter, better healthcare future for us all.

Get your Early Bird Ticket NOW

Events like this usually run $250 - $1,200 a ticket but for now you can get a great rate while we are finalizing details.  If you want to save about half, rsvp here in the next few days.  Ticketing is closing here 11/11.  Please visit http://medstartr.eventbrite.com to register.

A Special Message for Dues Paying Members

Dues Paying Members get reserved spots and $50 discounts!  We will send you a special registration code.  Thank you for your support!

How to get involved

• Volunteer!

• Apply to Pitch (Deadline Nov 20)

• Offer to be a great Panelist, Judge or Speaker

• Help us spread the word and be a Promotional Sponsor

• Get exhibitor space

• Sponsor and receive featured listing in publications, exhibitor space, credit for providing lunch or coffee

• Sponsor a Pitch Contest and Add to the Prize Packages

• Sponsor the After Party! 


Please email <a>[masked] </a>if you are interested in any of the above.

Thanks for being members and supporters of healthcare innovation!


Yours Truly,
Alex, Anthony, Mimi, and the H2NYC/ MedStartr team

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
Transmission of Buddhist Lotus Light Vigil Ceremony


Location:  The Riverside Church


 490 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10027

 Time:  1:30pm---3:30pm

 Date:  Monday， November 30, 2015

NO ENTRANCE TICKET REQUIRED,  SUBWAY STATION 116TH STREET


Join us for this remarkable Transmission of The Light Ceremony  Nov. 30th,  2015 when we will all pray for the world peace together. All are welcomed.


2500 years ago, Buddha transmitted Chan Lineage to his student. Generation after generation the Chan School has been transmitted from India to China without a breach in lineage.


The Dharma is like a light shining away the darkness of the world. During the Transmission of The Light Ceremony, the current Chan lineage holder will hand over  lotus Lamps to people. It symbolizes transiting Buddha’s Dharma to people. Bringing  lotus lamp home would symbolize bringing wisdom and compassion home.


May the light of the Buddha’s compassion shine upon all beings in the world, that they may receive true peace and tranquility and live beautiful and blessed lives.

results.description:
Tue, Dec 09, 2014

4:00pm - 5:30pm 6:00pm - 7:30pm

Event location:
Adorama In-Store Event Space

Everyone has looked up at the stars on a clear night and reveled at how beautiful the sky can be. With all the options for the right telescope, the choices are both endless and a bit confusing. Adorama welcomes Mike Dzurny from Meade Instruments as he discusses choosing the right telescope. He will also go through the following: Optical designs (refractor, reflector, etc)


Aperture and optical performance
Eyepieces and magnification
Tripods & mounts
Computer automation (Go-To)
Terrestrial viewing (City & Wilderness)
What can I see?
First night under the stars
What's best for me?

This seminar will be 2 repeating sessions at 90 minutes each.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square station, the 6th Avenue-14th Street station or 18th Street station.

Mike Dzurny has been Meade's New York salesman for over 25 years. His presentations are perfect for the entry-level telescope buyer due to his "keep it simple" approach. Mike: "I like to simplify technical stuff into something everyone can understand". Mike's methods make learning easy. In fact, he's an Instrument Rated airplane pilot who teaches twelve year old kids to fly his airplane in less than one hour! "Buying the right telescope is easy when you know what really matters."
results.name: SEMINAR: How to purchase and use your new telescope with Mike Dzurny
